result.execSummary:
The defendant Julian M Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Felony) AMENDED FROM 2nd DEG SEXUAL ASSAULT OF CHILD, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older AMENDED FROM 2nd DEG SEXUAL ASSAULT OF CHILD, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Mental health assessment and cognitive thinking class. Comply with family court order. Considered but rejected sex offender registration, sex offender evaluation and sex offender treatment program. No restriction on contact with minors. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Felony) AMENDED FROM 2nd DEG SEXUAL ASSAULT OF CHILD
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law, however, mandatory DNA surcharge is waived.

Mental health assessment and cognitive thinking class. Comply with family court order. Considered but rejected sex offender registration, sex offender evaluation and sex offender treatment program. No restriction on contact with minors. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
